content: ghostie pumpkin hanger notes this is a free crochet pattern designed by @wild tulip crochet please do not copy sell alter distribute or claim this work as your own this pattern is solely for personal use you may sell finished items made from this pattern but please credit wild tulip crochet as the designer and link back to my ig page @wild tulip crochet this pattern is written in us terminology materials & abbreviations worsted weight yarn magic_ring - magic_ring white orange sage & slip_stitch - slip_stitch black single_crochet - single_crochet 4 mm hook half_double_crochet - half_double_crochet 12 mm safety eyes bob - 4dc bobble stitch marker increase - increase stuffing decrease - decrease scissor flo - front loop only yarn needle ghostie round 1 magic_ring 6 6 round 2 increase x6 12 round 3 single_crochet increase x6 18 round 4 single_crochet 2 increase x6 24 rnds 5-8 single_crochet around 24 stitches for 4 rounds round 9 single_crochet 8 bob single_crochet 6 bob single_crochet 8 24 rnds 10-11 single_crochet around 24 stitches for 2 rounds round 12 flo *slip_stitch single_crochet half_double_crochet single_crochet * in the next repeat from * to * around 12 frills round 13 in the back loops from the previous round single_crochet 2 decrease x6 18 add eyes in between rounds 5-6 about 3 stitches apart stuff round 14 single_crochet decrease x6 12 round 15 decrease x6 6 cut yarn and weave in ends with black embroider a smile on round 7 pumpkin round 1 magic_ring 6 6 round 2 increase x6 12 round 3 single_crochet increase x6 18 round 4 single_crochet 2 increase x6 24 rnds 5-12 single_crochet around 24 stitches for 8 rounds round 13 single_crochet 2 decrease x6 18 stuff round 14 single_crochet decrease x6 12 round 15 decrease x6 6 cut yarn leaving a 24 tail for shaping the pumpkin next page sew the last round closed with sage slip_stitch onto a topmost stitch chain 5 slip_stitch into the 2nd chain from the hook and each chain across slip_stitch into the same place you joined cut yarn and weave in ends sage only pumpkin shaping with the long tail still on your needle insert your needle through the top center of the pumpkin and out through the bottom center pull tightly rotate the pumpkin 180° so that the tail is now on the opposite side insert your hook through the top center and out through the bottom center pull tightly you ll now have 2 ribs rotate the pumpkin 90° and insert your needle through the top center and out through the bottom center pull tightly rotate the pumpkin 180° and insert your hook through the top center and out through the bottom center pulling tightly you ll now have 4 ribs that make a + shape repeat the process 4 more times in between the 4 ribs this will give you the 8 ribs of your pumpkin hanger with black starting with a 6 tail chain 20 cut yarn leaving a 6
